class single_cell_analyzer.membrane_potential_analysis.SpikeInit[source]¶

Bases: object

Provides methods for analysis of spike initiation in in vivo/ in vitro simulations. Can be used to obtain features of spike shape, adaptation etc…

__init__()[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

static analyze_single_spike(cell, tVec, thresh)[source]¶

for comparison with in vitro spike shape: compute spike height, FWHM (duration), AHP

static analyze_spike_train()[source]¶
static vm_steady_state(cell, tVec, tStim, dtStim)[source]¶

computes “steady-state” subthreshold voltage from voltage trace during stimulation time window [tStim, tStim+dtStim] this can be used to define voltage spike threshold at current intensities just below AP initiation

single_cell_analyzer.membrane_potential_analysis.PSTH_from_spike_times(spikeTimeVectors, binSize=1.0, tBegin=None, tEnd=None, aligned=True)[source]¶

Calculate PSTH from vectors of spike times with optional bin size and time window [tBegin, tEnd]. If aligned=True, then the bins are aligned to integer multiples of the bin size.

single_cell_analyzer.membrane_potential_analysis.compute_mean_psp_amplitude(vTraces, tStim, dt)[source]¶
single_cell_analyzer.membrane_potential_analysis.compute_uPSP_amplitude(t, v, tSyn, isEPSP=True)[source]¶

simple method for determining amplitude of unitary PSP starting at time tSyn: Determine baseline as median Vm during 10ms preceding the PSP In case of IPSPs set isEPSP=False

single_cell_analyzer.membrane_potential_analysis.compute_vm_histogram(vTraces)[source]¶
single_cell_analyzer.membrane_potential_analysis.compute_vm_std_windows(vStd, tStim, dt)[source]¶
single_cell_analyzer.membrane_potential_analysis.simple_spike_detection(t, v, tBegin=None, tEnd=None, threshold=0.0, mode='regular')[source]¶

Simple spike detection method. Identify spike times within optional window [tBegin, tEnd] by determining threshold crossing times from below supported modes: regular: absolute threshold crossing differential: threshold crossing of dv/dt

single_cell_analyzer.membrane_potential_analysis.test_spike_detection_respects_threshold()[source]¶
single_cell_analyzer.membrane_potential_analysis.vm_mean(vVec, tVec, tStim, dtStim)[source]¶

computes mean subthreshold voltage from voltage trace during stimulation time window [tStim, tStim+dtStim]

single_cell_analyzer.membrane_potential_analysis.vm_std(vVec, tVec, tStim, dtStim)[source]¶

computes standard deviation of subthreshold voltage from voltage trace during stimulation time window [tStim, tStim+dtStim]

single_cell_analyzer.synanalysis module¶

Created on Apr 2, 2012

@author: regger

single_cell_analyzer.synanalysis.compute_distance_to_soma(sec, x, cell=None, consider_gap_to_soma=False)[source]¶

Computes the distance from a point specified by section and sectionx to the soma.

sec: section of cell, either a PySection object or an int x: float, relative point on section, from 0 to 1 cell: single_cell_parser Cell object, optional (only required if sec is given as an int) consider_gap_to_soma: boolean, optional. Accounts for the fact that dendrites don’t actually touch the soma.

single_cell_analyzer.synanalysis.compute_syn_distance(cell, syn, consider_gap_to_soma=False)[source]¶
single_cell_analyzer.synanalysis.compute_syn_distances(cell, synType, label=None, consider_gap_to_soma=False)[source]¶

computes distances of all synapses on dendrite w.r.t. soma

cell is cell object with attached synapses presynaptic cell type given by synType (string) optional: dendrite type given by label (string)

returns 1D numpy array of distances to soma

single_cell_analyzer.synanalysis.compute_syn_distances_2Dprojected(cell, synType, label=None)[source]¶

computes distances of all synapses on dendrite w.r.t. soma projected on 2D plane as seen during 2-photon spine imaging

cell is cell object with attached synapses presynaptic cell type given by synType (string) optional: dendrite type given by label (string)

returns 1D numpy array of distances to soma

single_cell_analyzer.synanalysis.compute_synapse_distances_times(fname, cell, t=None, synTypes=None)[source]¶
single_cell_analyzer.synanalysis.get_dist(x1, x2)[source]¶
single_cell_analyzer.synanalysis.synapse_activation_times(tVec, cntVec)[source]¶
single_cell_analyzer.synanalysis.synapse_distances(pname)[source]¶
single_cell_analyzer.synanalysis.synapse_distances_2D(pname)[source]¶

Module contents¶

library for analysis of simulation data (voltage traces, spike shapes, currents etc…) and anatomical data (synapse distances etc…)
